StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [SaveShipperSpecialRecogni.on]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
( @ID uniqueiden..er, @ShipperID int, @HighPFT bit, @HighShooter bit, @MeritPromo.on bit, @PlatoonHonorGrad bit, @SeriesHonorGrad bit, @CompanyHonorGrad bit, @LastEditBy varchar(200) ) AS BEGIN
BEGIN TRANSACTION
IF EXISTS(SELECT ID FROM [USMC].[Shipper_SpecialRecogni.on] WHERE [ID] = @ID) BEGIN UPDATE [USMC].[Shipper_SpecialRecogni.on] SET [ShipperID] = @ShipperID, [HighPFT] = @HighPFT, [HighShooter] = @HighShooter, [MeritPromo.on] = @MeritPromo.on, [PlatoonHonorGrad] = @PlatoonHonorGrad, [SeriesHonorGrad] = @SeriesHonorGrad, [CompanyHonorGrad] = @CompanyHonorGrad WHERE [ID] = @ID END ELSE BEGIN INSERT INTO [USMC].[Shipper_SpecialRecogni.on] ( [ID], [ShipperID], [HighPFT], [HighShooter], [MeritPromo.on], [PlatoonHonorGrad], [SeriesHonorGrad], [CompanyHonorGrad] ) VALUES ( @ID, @ShipperID, @HighPFT, @HighShooter, @MeritPromo.on, @PlatoonHonorGrad, @SeriesHonorGrad, @CompanyHonorGrad )
END
-- Rollback the transac.on if there were any errors IF @@ERROR <> 0 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('Error occurred while performing the change.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- Rollback the transac.on if the number of rows changed does not meet our expecta.on... IF @@ROWCOUNT > 1 BEGIN -- Rollback the transac.on ROLLBACK TRANSACTION
-- Raise an error and return RAISERROR ('An unexpected number of rows were changed.', 16, 1) RETURN END
-- If we reach this point, the commands completed successfully. COMMIT TRANSACTION END
